message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using data from the World Development Indicators and the International Debt Statistics, this study analyzes the relationship between external debt and economic growth.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators", "International Debt Statistics"], "topic": ["Debt", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "This paper studies the impact of infrastructure investments on firm productivity, using a firm-level dataset from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys in conjunction with the Infrastructure Database for Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "Infrastructure Database for Sub-Saharan Africa"], "topic": ["Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "We combined two complementary datasets, the Multidimensional Poverty Index and the National Socio-Economic Survey, to explore patterns of poverty and inequality across regions and social groups in India.", "dataset": ["Multidimensional Poverty Index", "National Socio-Economic Survey"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses a unique dataset on household water consumption in combination with weather data from the Climate Prediction Center to estimate the impact of climate change on household water demand.", "dataset": ["household water consumption", "weather data from the Climate Prediction Center"], "topic": ["Water", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze the determinants of financial inclusion using data from the Global Findex and Demographic and Health Surveys, and find that access to mobile banking services has a positive effect on financial inclusion among women in developing countries.", "dataset": ["Global Findex", "Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "In this paper, we use the REN21 Renewables Global Status Report and the Global Wind Atlas to examine the potential for wind energy development in different regions of the world and identify barriers to its deployment.", "dataset": ["REN21 Renewables Global Status Report", "Global Wind Atlas"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We investigate the impact of public-private partnerships on urban development using data on infrastructure investments and outcomes from the World Bank Public-Private Partnership database and the Urbanization Reviews.", "dataset": ["World Bank Public-Private Partnership database", "Urbanization Reviews"], "topic": ["Public-Private Partnerships", "Urban Development"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses data from the LSMS-ISA to examine the determinants of food insecurity in rural areas of Ethiopia, while controlling for various socio-economic factors such as income, education, and access to water sources.", "dataset": ["LSMS-ISA"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "We employ a panel dataset from the World Bank Open Data Platform, covering over 150 countries and regions, to investigate the relationship between trade openness and income inequality over time.", "dataset": ["World Bank Open Data Platform"], "topic": ["Trade", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "In this article, we compare two datasets on child malnutrition, namely the Demographic and Health Surveys and the Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys, and explore how differences in sampling strategies may affect prevalence estimates and policy recommendations.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]} ]

content: [{"sentence": "Using data from the World Development Indicators and the International Debt Statistics, this study analyzes the relationship between external debt and economic growth.",
